subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – perhaps a shed. Originally using the similar-sounding word {{och-l|廬|shed, cabin}} to represent the concept “six” (Liu Xinglong). Alternatively, it may be an ancient counting symbol.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: The ablaut form of [[三|mi]] "three", which it doubles.
